1.text: For this, I Paul, the imprisoned of Christ Jesus for you the nations,

2.text: If ye have heard of the distribution of the grace of God given to me for you:

3.text: That by revelation he made Known to me the mystery; (as I before wrote briefly,

4.text: By which ye, reading, can perceive My understanding in the mystery of Christ,)

5.text: Which in other generations was not made known to the sons of men, as now has been revealed to his holy sent and to the prophets by the Spirit:

6.text: For the nations to be co-heirs, and united in one body, and, participators of his solemn promise in Christ by the good news:

7.text: Of which I Became a servant, according to the gift of the grace of God given to me according to the energy of his power.

8.text: To me, the least of all the holy ones, was this grace given, to announce the good news in the nations, the untraceable riches of Christ.

9.text: And to enlighten all what the distribution of the mystery, concealed from times immemorial in God, having created all things by Jesus Christ:

10.text: That it might now be made known to beginnings and powers in the heavenlies by the church the manifold wisdom of God,

11.text: According to the purpose of times immemorial which he made in Christ Jesus our Lord:

12.text: In whom we have freedom of speech and access with confidence by his faith.

13.text: Wherefore I desire not to lose courage in my pressures for you, which is your glory.

14.text: For this I bend my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

15.text: Of whom all the family in the heavens and upon earth is named,

16.text: That he might give to you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with power by his Spirit in the interior man;

17.text: For Christ to dwell by faith in your hearts; in love being rendered firm, and the foundation laid,

18.text: That ye might be fully able to comprehend with all the holy what the length, and breadth, and depth, and height;

19.text: To know also the love of Christ, surpassing knowledge, that ye might be filled in all the fulness of God.

20.text: And to him being able to do above all things more abundantly above what we ask or think, according to the power being energetic in us,

21.text: To him the glory in the church in Christ Jesus to all generations of the times of times. Amen.
